comments.body: `state` parameter shouldn't be a required param, you can set the default value for `state` as `present` and make any other module parameter as required param (e.g. pn_cliswitch/pn_name)
@justjais Its a standard what we have used for all modules. If it is mandatory and required i can changed it else i would prefer to use same.

@rajaspachipulusu17, apologies if it was missed in earlier review but to be consistent with Ansible I had suggested this change, so if from this module you can start implementing the suggestion I made would be great, coz if you think user can run the module just by passing `state` as parameter which ultimately shall do nothing. So ideally the parameter that's mandatory from module functionality prospects should be made `required=True`.
ref: I can run the module as following, which will do nothing:
```
- name: Create prefix list
  pn_prefix_list:
    state: "present"
```
